title: The Right Honorable William Pitt, the younger
credit_line: Bequest of Jebba Dixon Wiggin in memory of Harold Hansard Robertson
provenance_text:
Marquesses of Londonderry with Owen Edgar Gallery, London, England. Likely Harold Hansard Robertson [1878-1950], Pittsburgh, PA and Hyannis Port, MA, until September 19, 1950; his wife Mrs. Jebba D. Robinson, later Jebba Dixon Wiggin [d. 1978], Pittsburgh, PA and Hyannis Port, MA, until October 23, 1978 [1]; estate of Jebba Dixon Wiggin, until bequest to Museum of Art, Carnegie Institute, May 1979 [2].

Notes:
[1]. Mr. Robertson married the former Mrs. Edward Rhodes-Moorhouse of London in 1938. Apparently, after Mr. Robertson's death in September 1950, she remarried.
[2]. The bequest was accepted by Carnegie Institute on December 12, 1978; the painting was subsequently shipped from Mrs. Wiggins' summer residence in Hyannis Port, MA and accessioned on May 10, 1979 (see curatorial file for correspondence with Pittsburgh National Bank as executor of the estate.)

Updated and under review by CGK.
